wellcomeml.metrics package¶

Submodules¶

wellcomeml.metrics.f1 module¶

Whole test set and batchwise f1 metrics for use with keras

Adapted from: https://www.kaggle.com/rejpalcz/best-loss-function-for-f1-score-metric

wellcomeml.metrics.f1.f1_loss(y_true, y_pred)¶

Generate batchwise macro f1 loss

>>> model.compile(
>>>     loss=f1_loss,
>>>     optimizer="adam",
>>>     metrics=["accuracy"]
>>> )
wellcomeml.metrics.f1.f1_metric(y_true, y_pred)¶

Calculate batchwise macro f1

>>> model.compile(
>>>     loss="binary_crossentropy",
>>>     optimizer="adam",
>>>     metrics=["accuracy", f1_metric]
>>> )

wellcomeml.metrics.ner_classification_report module¶

wellcomeml.metrics.ner_classification_report.ner_classification_report(y_true, y_pred, groups, tags)¶

Evaluate the model’s performance for each grouping of data for the NER labels given in ‘tags’

Input:

y_pred: a list of predicted entities y_true: a list of gold entities groups: (str) the group each of the pred or gold entities belong to

Output:
report: evaluation metrics for each group

in a nice format for printing

Module contents¶

wellcomeml.metrics.f1_loss(y_true, y_pred)¶

Generate batchwise macro f1 loss

>>> model.compile(
>>>     loss=f1_loss,
>>>     optimizer="adam",
>>>     metrics=["accuracy"]
>>> )
wellcomeml.metrics.f1_metric(y_true, y_pred)¶

Calculate batchwise macro f1

>>> model.compile(
>>>     loss="binary_crossentropy",
>>>     optimizer="adam",
>>>     metrics=["accuracy", f1_metric]
>>> )
wellcomeml.metrics.ner_classification_report(y_true, y_pred, groups, tags)¶

Evaluate the model’s performance for each grouping of data for the NER labels given in ‘tags’

Input:

y_pred: a list of predicted entities y_true: a list of gold entities groups: (str) the group each of the pred or gold entities belong to

Output:
report: evaluation metrics for each group

in a nice format for printing
